unnormalised: ## Time Flies (Especially When You're Avoiding Work)
normalised: Time Flies (Especially When You're Avoiding Work)

unnormalised: We’ve all been there, haven’t we? Staring blankly at the clock, willing it to magically jump forward. Perhaps it's a Monday morning (or, let's be honest, any morning). Or maybe you’re waiting for the chai break at precisely 15:30 hrs. The struggle is real. Our local news cycle has become a hilarious testament to this shared experience, with each day seemingly stretching longer than a Bollywood wedding.
normalised: We’ve all been there, haven’t we? Staring blankly at the clock, willing it to magically jump forward. Perhaps it's a Monday morning (or, let's be honest, any morning). Or maybe you’re waiting for the chai break at precisely fifteen thirty hours. The struggle is real. Our local news cycle has become a hilarious testament to this shared experience, with each day seemingly stretching longer than a Bollywood wedding.

unnormalised: Take, for instance, the recent "incident" on 1/4/2024. A local politician, known for his lengthy speeches, promised a "quick" announcement at 11 AM sharp. Fast forward to 14:00 hrs, and he was still warming up the crowd with anecdotes about his childhood in Nagpur. The audience, originally scheduled to have lunch at 12:30 PM, were by then contemplating cannibalism. Finally, at 16:17, he revealed his earth-shattering news: a new speed breaker was being installed near the railway crossing. Riveting.
normalised: Take, for instance, the recent "incident" on first april two thousand and twenty four. A local politician, known for his lengthy speeches, promised a "quick" announcement at eleven A M sharp. Fast forward to fourteen zero zero hours, and he was still warming up the crowd with anecdotes about his childhood in Nagpur. The audience, originally scheduled to have lunch at twelve thirty P M, were by then contemplating cannibalism. Finally, at sixteen seventeen, he revealed his earth-shattering news: a new speed breaker was being installed near the railway crossing. Riveting.

unnormalised: And then there was the case of the missing samosas. On 22/05/2024, a local kitty party reported the theft of approximately 50 samosas. Police were called, investigations were launched, and the story made headlines for a full 3 days. The prime suspect? Mrs. Sharma's cat, Mittens, who was last seen near the buffet table around 17:00 hrs. The mystery remains unsolved to this day, though theories abound, ranging from a samosa-loving ghost to a highly organized gang of pigeons. A reward of Rs. 500 was offered, but no leads materialized.
normalised: And then there was the case of the missing samosas. On twenty second May two thousand and twenty four, a local kitty party reported the theft of approximately fifty samosas. Police were called, investigations were launched, and the story made headlines for a full three days. The prime suspect? Missus Sharma's cat, Mittens, who was last seen near the buffet table around seventeen zero zero hours. The mystery remains unsolved to this day, though theories abound, ranging from a samosa-loving ghost to a highly organized gang of pigeons. A reward of rupees five hundred was offered, but no leads materialized.

unnormalised: The weather forecast has also become a source of comic relief. According to the Met Department, the monsoon was supposed to arrive on 10/06/2024. However, it only decided to make a cameo appearance on 25/06/2024, lasting a grand total of 17 minutes. Farmers were left scratching their heads, wondering if they should plant their crops or just invest in a good sunscreen. Meteorologists, meanwhile, blamed "unforeseen atmospheric disturbances," which, in layman's terms, probably means "we have no idea what's going on."
normalised: The weather forecast has also become a source of comic relief. According to the Met Department, the monsoon was supposed to arrive on tenth June two thousand and twenty four. However, it only decided to make a cameo appearance on twenty fifth June two thousand and twenty four, lasting a grand total of seventeen minutes. Farmers were left scratching their heads, wondering if they should plant their crops or just invest in a good sunscreen. Meteorologists, meanwhile, blamed "unforeseen atmospheric disturbances," which, in layman's terms, probably means "we have no idea what's going on."

unnormalised: Our traffic reporters, too, deserve a medal of honor (or at least a complimentary auto-rickshaw ride). Every day, they bravely venture into the chaotic streets of Mumbai, armed with nothing but a microphone and a prayer. On 03/07/2024, they reported a "minor delay" on the Western Express Highway. This minor delay, as it turned out, involved a rogue cow, a runaway wedding procession, and a truck full of mangoes. Commuters were stuck for a solid 4 hrs, but hey, at least they had mangoes.
normalised: Our traffic reporters, too, deserve a medal of honor (or at least a complimentary auto-rickshaw ride). Every day, they bravely venture into the chaotic streets of Mumbai, armed with nothing but a microphone and a prayer. On third July two thousand and twenty four, they reported a "minor delay" on the Western Express Highway. This minor delay, as it turned out, involved a rogue cow, a runaway wedding procession, and a truck full of mangoes. Commuters were stuck for a solid four hours, but hey, at least they had mangoes.

unnormalised: Even our cultural events are running on "Indian Standard Time," which, as we all know, is roughly 2 hours behind schedule. The Diwali celebrations, traditionally held on 04/11/2024, didn't actually kick off until the evening of 05/11/2024, by which point everyone was too full of sweets to light any fireworks. The organizers blamed "unavoidable circumstances," which probably involved a last-minute guest appearance by a Bollywood celebrity and a logistical nightmare involving 10,000 diyas.
normalised: Even our cultural events are running on "Indian Standard Time," which, as we all know, is roughly two hours behind schedule. The Diwali celebrations, traditionally held on fourth November two thousand and twenty four, didn't actually kick off until the evening of fifth November two thousand and twenty four, by which point everyone was too full of sweets to light any fireworks. The organizers blamed "unavoidable circumstances," which probably involved a last-minute guest appearance by a Bollywood celebrity and a logistical nightmare involving ten thousand diyas.

unnormalised: So, the next time you find yourself impatiently waiting for something – be it the end of a Zoom meeting at 14:00 or the arrival of your pizza at 20:30 - remember that you're not alone. We're all in this together, navigating the wonderfully unpredictable flow of time, Indian Standard Time, that is. And hey, at least we have plenty of hilarious news stories to keep us entertained while we wait.
normalised: So, the next time you find yourself impatiently waiting for something – be it the end of a Zoom meeting at fourteen zero zero or the arrival of your pizza at twenty thirty - remember that you're not alone. We're all in this together, navigating the wonderfully unpredictable flow of time, Indian Standard Time, that is. And hey, at least we have plenty of hilarious news stories to keep us entertained while we wait.
